Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Demotic ostracon
Description: This ostracon of the Ptolemaic Period is inscribed on two sides. It contains a Demotic letter mentioning a certain man named Osoroeris who declares his innocence concerning the "affair" of the great god Amun and the  great goddess Isis. The text also gives a series of practical depositions. The Theban origin of the piece is suggested by the mention of Pinyris, the "prophet of Amun".
